website_summaries.verdict: There's a lot to like about the JBL Reflect, particularly the fit, but some performance drawbacks hurt its value.
pros: The JBL Reflect Aware in-ear sports headphones offer a secure, comfortable fit, are sweat-resistant, and have an integrated Lightning connector and reflective cord
They also feature active noise cancellation, and a companion app allows you to adjust ambient noise levels and customize EQ settings
cons: Lightning connection draws a small amount of power from your phone and reduces battery life
no adapter included to plug the headphone into a standard headphone jack

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Got this item today and took it for a test run. It initially worked with reduction of sound by about 40 to 50 percent, which is acceptable to me, but then, while listening, it died. I would have to unplug it and shut down my iPhone X and reboot in order to get a few extra minutes of a podcast. It is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Cycle Cyril

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Headphones with Iphone 7 Lightning jack.
customer_reviews.text: The Sound is perfect. I have bought so many headphones and never truly satisfied with the sound. I have a full-range of music genre in my iphone. I enjoy Hard Rock, Classical, Alternative, Country, Acoustic, Heavy Metal and Opera and of course some pop. What I love must about this is not only does it do an excellent job on cancelling noise, but the APP that you can download from App Store, you can adjust the EQ settings. Vocal, Bass, Jazz, and even customize your own Equalization settings. You can adjust the High, Mid and the Low Range. Awesome! and it sounds perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Baysider

customer_reviews.title: iPhone connection only.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good all-around headphones. They don’t drain the battery too bad. NC is pretty effective. Noise isolation pretty good. Might be a little bass heavy for some. I typically have issues keeping buds in and have small ears but these come with enough figment options to work. For the money a very solid set.
customer_reviews.author: ArchEtech

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but not fully sweat resistant...  disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I have only had these headphones a short period of time. They have been fairly good for a relatively inexpensive pair of headphones. My biggest complaint that caused me to rate them low overall is that they have stopped working while I am working out at the gym. They are water resistant and say they can be used to workout. I am very careful with all electronics I own, and these generally spring back to life once they air out for a bit after the gym. The performance outside of this has been good, it would be nice if they did not have this issue with sweat at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great earbugs
customer_reviews.text: Using on an iphone 11 pro max. The JBL app isn't great, but it works, it has bugs with the EQ configuration, just disable the EQ. Sometimes the earphones crash and you need to remove and insert them again. The ANC works, they're in your ear which helps too. I use the USB-C version too, the ANC is great on flights.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Decent headphones, memorize the customer support number.
customer_reviews.text: Never write reviews but would avoid these headphones. First pair died after six months, second pair (after RMA) has little / no sound from right earphone. Be prepared to contact customer service a lot to use your new headphones... Edit: Second pair of headphones through RMA have about 25% sound in the left ear. Awful - avoid this set.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Smith

customer_reviews.title: Another one bites the dust.
customer_reviews.text: Another pair that doesn’t live up to what they are selling. Constantly falling out of ears even after “adjusting” them. Save yourself the time, energy, and money, and just buy Beats. Sound was good. Didn’t get to use the noise cancelling part since they kept falling out of my ears. The cord is too short to leave hang while running, and not long enough to wrap around once to make it comfortable. Thoroughly disappointed by this product too.
customer_reviews.author: Geo G

customer_reviews.title: Not really water resistant!
customer_reviews.text: These are not really water resistant. The first time that I got caught in the rain they completely stopped working. After only a month of use.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Alyn Porter

customer_reviews.title: Bad noise cancellation on OK headphones
customer_reviews.text: They fit nicely and stay in my ears. The sound quality is decent. The really disappointing thing is the noise cancellation or lack of it. When it is turned on all it does is add digital noise to the background, distorting the outside noise. Definitely not worth the asking price.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan M. Burger

customer_reviews.title: Great looking product great sound and ambient aware is ok
customer_reviews.text: Had to reduce rating to 2 stars after they suddenly died on the second use. Great looking product great sound and ambient aware is ok, even on the highest setting it is hard to discern over music or audible book. Very very dissapointed they did not last 😔 Save your money and buy the Sony Walkman head set with ambient aware or other higher quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Lemler

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Had to play with the different size ear pieces until I found the right match. These headphones are super comfortable and sound great. As the directions state, you need to twist them up into your ear. Doing this, you achieve a snug fit and great sound.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Kowaleski

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money For headphones. The biggest mistake is when a call comes in you can’t use the earphones. Furthermore, the earphones don’t have the same sound quality as each other. We would’ve never of bought them if we knew you can’t talk through them.
customer_reviews.author: K.S.

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced Meh Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound decent, not great. There is no discernible difference in background noise with the ANC on or off. I was able to tell within 5 minutes these were not for me. Sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: Incoherent Drivel

customer_reviews.title: awesome minus the mic
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for noise canceling and they sound great but no one can ever hear me when i get a call. Have to trade them out when i know ill get a call.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... back waiting to see if the second pair works good
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working with in he first week send it back waiting to see if the second pair works good
customer_reviews.author: ERB

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to use for my motorcycle but noise cancelling is not as good as BOSE ones I have
customer_reviews.text: It's Ok headphones, I wanted to use for my motorcycle but noise cancelling is not as good as BOSE ones I have, also, lack of pass through charging port is big minus.
customer_reviews.author: Dariusz Stochmal

customer_reviews.title: Good noise canceling for riding the mower
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second pair after loosing an earbud on the first one
customer_reviews.author: S. W. Brown

customer_reviews.title: It's very stable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It's very stable and easy to use. No issue at all. Good sound and volume. It's very good fit to my ears.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Best in Ear
customer_reviews.text: I have many kinds. These are the best in ear. Like the EQ in the App.
customer_reviews.author: SPFOSTER

customer_reviews.title: At least an in-ear headphone with a lightning cable.
customer_reviews.text: Great in-ear headphones... But doesn't fit perfectly in my ears. Quality excellent, sound excellent, and waterproof. The cable is the best I have used. The only one for the moment with a lightning cable. I recommend
customer_reviews.author: Freddy Frog

customer_reviews.title: Love the Lightning Connector, Hate the Poor Quality Noise Cancellation
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy these off Amazon after JBL unexpectedly cancelled my pre-order for these. The sound quality is good for a mid price pair of headphones. I like the lightning connector and not having to kill my battery life running Bluetooth. My biggest complaint as will all the other reviewers here is with the poor noise cancelling performance. For $150 I was expecting a lot more. I recently retired these after trying the Q Adapt Noise Cancelling earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: When they work, they're great.
customer_reviews.text: But, they broke within 1 month of casual usage. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Blokfort

customer_reviews.title: They do have good sound, but if you are in noisy areas
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in the hope that they would provide greater noise cancellation. They do have good sound, but if you are in noisy areas, they may not live up to your expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C. Tackett

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for market
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with the flat bland sound produced from these. Messing with the controls didn't improve sound. Had hoped they would be great, but I guess the makers of earbuds haven't figured out yet how to make great lightning earbuds. I use Hifiman RE400s and the sound quality with a lightning adapter on my iPhone 7 sounds vastly superior to the JBLs. Also the earbuds quite uncomfortable. One star is too much for these. Don't waste time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Alphawar

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good but they died within a week. The cord is too short and the active noise canceling drains the battery and to change anything you need to go through their app. The bose soundtrue is a better buy for roughly the same price. Lesson learned
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Bogart

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable fit. this is not a JBL sound i know.....sorry JBL but i am returning this Headphone.
customer_reviews.author: ks0002

customer_reviews.title: I GOT THESE IN-EAR PHONES FOR THERE NOISE CANCELLING BUT ...
customer_reviews.text: I GOT THESE IN-EAR PHONES FOR THERE NOISE CANCELLING BUT THEY REALLY LACK ANY NOISE CANCELLING. THEY DONT SEAM TO CANCELL ANY OUTSIDE NOISE AT ALL. I WILL MOST LIKELY RETURN SINCE I AM NOT GETTING WHAT I PAID FOR!!!
customer_reviews.author: CARLOS A HERNANDEZ

customer_reviews.title: Great for what they are.
customer_reviews.text: I found these to be excellent headphones for the price. I bought these because I was tired of my wireless headphones running out of batteries on my longer hikes or workouts. It’s nice to be able to plug them and just go. It’s also great to be able to control the volume and pause and play from the headphone’s control module on the wire instead of needing to handle the phone. I’m not saying these would work if you’re looking for 4K surround sound videos but they make great workouts headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Good, but immediately became incompatible with iPhone
customer_reviews.text: I liked these earbuds for the few days that I was able to use them. They quickly became impossible to use with my iPhone, however. Every time I plugged them in the phone would give me a dreadful "accessory not supported" message and the sound would play from the phone speakers instead of the earbuds. I tried everything. The lightning connector was nearly new and perfectly clean. My iPhone's port works with every other accessory and charger that I try. It must be the earbuds. Extremely frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great earphones with great customer support
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these before buying an iPhone 7. They sound great, and the wire is durable enough that it has lasted rolled up in my briefcase with no damage to performance. Most important, however, has been the customer service. I lost the right earpiece attachments yanking the earphones off an airplane seat, and JBL sent over replacements at no charge! Hard to beat that, particularly since the earpieces are among the best I have ever tried.
customer_reviews.author: Chazi P

customer_reviews.title: Three reasons I regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Three reasons I regret this purchase: 1. The speaker for phone calls is useless. People ask me to get off my headphones because they cannot hear me. 2. They are not sport headphones. Way too bulky and too heavy to be used while doing anything other than sitting. 3. The rubber cover that fits in your ears falls off the headphone constantly. I lost the initial pair within 6 minutes. I superglued the replacement rubber pieces so they won’t get lost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'd pay $50-$75 for these. Retail should be $100.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these with type-c connector for my Android. They're super comfy, but sound quality is subpar and the noise cancellation is nearly non-existent. What little noise cancellation you get is likely from the earbuds themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feeling Cheated
customer_reviews.text: I had got these pair bundled with HTC 10. They stopped working in less than two months...no water or sweat damage done, now they are saying they will get it replaced only inside US, since i am living in India now, its impossible for me to get it replaced. Although during the period of usage i was blown away by the sound quality, but replacement policy is so ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: Gautham V.

customer_reviews.title: The sound is very good. The fit is not perfect
customer_reviews.text: They work well. The sound is very good. The fit is not perfect. Didn't fit me as well as other iems. The app is flawless. I can appreciate the difference in the noise cancellation settings but I kept is at max noise cancelling most of the time. I don't bike or run.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: #Fail within 1 week
customer_reviews.text: This product failed within the first week I bought it. I think the "sweatproof" part does not hold for the lightning connector. I was not super unhappy with the audio quality but I started missing my 3.5mm jack and series of wired headphones and still have not gotten the replacement which is the least I would have expected. Very poor.
customer_reviews.author: bmukund

product_meta.title: JBL Reflect Aware in-Ear Sport Headphones with Lightning (Black)
product_meta.description: Color:BlackYou will receive: 1 JBL Reflect Aware Sport Headphone with Noise Cancellation and Adaptive Noise Control Stay aware while staying active.Get the most out of your exercises by filtering what gets in. The new JBL Reflect Aware sport earphones delivers both best in class noise cancellation and the ability to mix in sound from your environment for greater awareness of your surroundings when you want it, making it the most versatile sport headphone on the market. Designed for sport with a unique reflective design, the JBL Reflect Aware earphones, feature legendary JBL sound and an ergonomic fit design that keeps the earpieces in place regardless of the intensity of your workout routine. Sweatproof and available in blue, black, red, teal, the JBL Reflect Aware earphones require no battery because they draw power and digital audio directly from the lightning connector on Apple devices.
feature_bullets: Noise cancellation with adaptive noise control for adjustable ambient sound
Lightning connector for Apple devices, including the iPhone 7, iPhone 8, iPhone X, iPad Air, Air 2, & iPad Pro
Enjoy JBL's best in class noise cancellation technologies and adjust the adaptive noise control for as much or as little outside noise as you want
Highly reflective colorful cables for maximum visibility

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars60 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
